channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest crypto news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Alibaba, silver, gold, Bitcoin, Ethereum: Mike Novogratz's ideal portfolio
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: During a recent interview with Bloomberg Wealth, Novogratz touched on topics ranging from investing to Ripple's case and Larry Fink.

item.title: Bitcoin due key MACD bull flag repeat as BTC price freezes at $29.3K
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: BTC price action is "slower than ever" this weekend, but Bitcoin market participants are keenly waiting for a monthly MACD cross to confirm.

item.title: 5 Python libraries to interpret machine learning models
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alice Ivey
item.description: Python libraries that can interpret and explain machine learning models provide valuable insights into their predictions and ensure transparency in AI applications.

item.title: Pro-XRP lawyer claims SEC prioritizes corporate capitalism over investors
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: John Deaton believes the unequal treatment raises concerns about the regulatory body’s effectiveness and fairness, as well as the overall framework for digital assets.

item.title: DOJ wants SBF’s bail revoked over witness tampering, diary leak allegations
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: The filing revealed that on Jan. 15, 2023, SBF contacted the current general counsel of FTX US, who could potentially serve as a witness in the trial.

item.title: Crypto community reacts to Barbie star saying Bitcoin talk exudes Ken energy
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: Michael Saylor, Layah Heilpern and Girl Gone Crypto were among those in the crypto community that took an interest in what Australian actress Margot Robbie had to say about Bitcoin.

item.title: Blockchain could save financial institutions $10B by 2030: Ripple
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: Among the 300 finance professionals surveyed across 45 countries, 97% believe that blockchain will play a crucial role in faster payment systems within the next three years.

item.title: US crypto bills on the move, Worldcoin launches and Russia’s CBDC: Hodler’s Digest, July 23-29
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Editorial Staff
item.description: Crypto legislation goes to the House floor in the U.S., Worldcoin’s controversial launch and Russia’s digital ruble signed into law.

item.title: Court reverses SEC ruling on SPIKES futures, calls it “arbitrary and capricious”
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The decision relates to an SEC order from 2020 exempting the SPIKES Index from the definition of securities futures.

item.title: Price analysis 7/29: BTC, ETH, XRP, BNB, ADA, SOL, DOGE, MATIC, LTC, DOT
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin’s price action remains lackluster, but select altcoins are showing signs of breaking out of their respective resistance levels.

item.title: GitHub, Hugging Face, urge EU to relax open-source AI rules
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: An open letter calls for a review of the European AI Act, claiming that existing provisions would hinder open-source AI development.

item.title: Kansas Heartland Tri-State Bank closed by FDIC as banking crisis deepens
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Heartland Tri-State Bank of Elkhart was closed on July 29, with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation taking control.

item.title: X’s ad revenue sharing: Crypto payments on the horizon?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: Should Elon Musk’s platform choose to introduce crypto payments in the future, Stripe’s on-ramp service could prove beneficial.

item.title: Worldcoin stuck after 70% drop from peak — More downside for WLD price?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.description: WLD price may get anchored to $2 until October, primarily due to its initial supply distribution.

item.title: Lawmakers probe Apple’s App Store policies on blockchain, NFTs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: Their letter aimed to explore whether these guidelines might inadvertently hinder the progress and growth of cutting-edge innovations.

item.title: US banking advocacy group supports Sen. Warren’s reintroduced crypto bill
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.category: the National Consumer Law Center and the National Consumers League
item.description: According to the Bank Policy Institute, including digital assets in the Anti-Money Laundering framework is essential for safeguarding the United States financial system.

item.title: SEC, Binance unite against Eeon’s lawsuit intervention
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amaka Nwaokocha
item.description: The U.S. SEC claims that Eeon has a history of repeatedly unsuccessfully representing itself in court cases.

item.title: Hester Pierce strikes back against SEC crypto warning to accounting firms
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: Hester Pierce, a United States Securities and Exchange Commission commissioner, argued that full transparency should not come at the cost of compromising good-faith efforts.

item.title: Worldcoin releases audit reports showing resolved security issues
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: The proof of humanity protocol released security audit reports claiming that most issues were fixed or mitigated.

item.title: Worldcoin is making reality look like a lot like Black Mirror
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Matthew Niemerg
item.description: OpenAI’s sister company Worldcoin wants you to buy its coin — and possibly unleash a tempest of problems across the world in the process.

item.title: German regulator raised concerns about Binance CEO prior to license application withdrawal: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: BaFin reportedly advised Binance that CEO Changpeng Zhao wouldn’t pass a “fit and proper” test as part of the financial watchdog’s licensing regime.

item.title: Another week of DeFi hacks, but ZK-proof development heats up: Finance Redefined
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: The total value locked in DeFi protocols remained below $50 billion after another week of exploits.

item.title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Serge Egon Ostman
item.category: why did the Fed pause rates
item.description: Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting the Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

item.title: Pond0X token launch snafu leads to millions of dollars in losses
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: Investors reported they lost up to $2.2 million when the developer of Pond0x allegedly mishandled the token’s launch.

item.title: Seda co-founders discuss intersection of oracles and multichain
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Oracles enable value, but they are also susceptible to value manipulation; co-founders of Cosmos-based Seda discuss their benefits and how to prevent pitfalls.

item.title: Crypto Biz: Elon Musk’s X targets financial services, PacWest emergency rescue and more
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: This week’s Crypto Biz explores Elon Musk’s plans for X, the Italian central bank’s take on DeFi, PacWest’s merger with Banc of California and more.

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried’s legal team turns over docs related to NYT story, requests they be sealed
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Lawyers claimed there was a “need to avoid” the public dissemination of documents Sam Bankman-Fried had shown a New York Times reporter that led to a story on Caroline Ellison.

item.title: BTC price shrugs off strong PCE data as Bitcoin traders eye $28K range
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin traders expect downside as BTC price offers a muted reaction to the Fed’s “preferred” inflation metric.

item.title: 6 Questions for Simon Davis of Mighty Bear Games
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Mighty Bear Games CEO Simon Davis — AKA “Papa Bear” — gave us a look inside his Web3 gaming studio, and his thoughts on the future of gaming.

item.title: French privacy watchdog questions Worldcoin’s data collection method: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Savannah Fortis
item.description: French data protection agency CNIL said it finds the legality of Worldcoin’s collection methods “questionable” alongside the conditions for storing the data.
